attributes.action: Calculate the VAT on fuel at cost per litre, not after the Fuel Tax has been added.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The breakdown of a £1 litre of fuel is calculated as so.

36p cost to petroleum company.
47p in Fuel Duty
14.5p in VAT
+ 2p for the retailer

If it was calculated properly, i.e. the VAT calculated on 36p, the cost per litre to the consumer would be about 91p, a saving of 9p or thereabouts.
